intro: Eriolytrum, commonly known as the grass vernal, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and are characterized by their slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. Eriolytrum species are often found in temperate regions and thrive in well-drained soils. They are known for their ability to bloom in early spring, contributing to the early floral display in gardens and natural habitats. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
